clinical_study.brief_title: The Emotion Builder: An Intervention for Emotional Deficits After Brain Injury
clinical_study.official_title: The Emotion Builder: An Intervention for Emotional Deficits After Brain Injury

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine a web-based training program for treating emotional problems in people who have suffered a traumatic brain injury (TBI).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a pilot study to examine how subjects with TBI feel about the virtual reality program as a treatment and to assess the effectiveness of the virtual reality program at increasing subjects' awareness and understanding of emotions.

primary_outcome.description: This is a 20-item self-report questionnaire comprised of three sub-constructs (Difficulty Identifying feelings, Difficulty Describing Feelings, Externally-oriented Thinking)

The LEAS is comprised of ten hypothetical scenarios that are three or four sentences in length. Participants are asked to infer how they and another person would feel given a described situation (open-ended responses).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) as an assessment of depression
secondary_outcome.description: The PHQ-9 is a self-report questionnaire designed to assess depression through nine questions that come directly from the DSM-IV signs and symptoms of major depression.
This is a self-report measure of state and trait anxiety (20 items each).

arm_group.description: Treatment sessions with a virtual treatment program called Emotion Builder

intervention.description: Total of 8 therapy sessions with the Emotion Builder over approximately four (4) weeks (2 sessions a week)

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Research Professor, Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, IU School of Medicine
